  • Method Details

    • readInt

      public static int readInt(String prompt)
      Reads an integer from the user with a given prompt. Continues to prompt until a valid integer is entered.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The prompt message to display to the user.
      Returns:
      The integer entered by the user.

    • readDate

      public static LocalDateTime readDate()
      Reads a LocalDateTime input from the user in the format "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm". Continues to prompt until a valid date and time are entered.
      Returns:
      LocalDateTime object representing the entered date and time.

    • readInt

      public static int readInt(String prompt, int min, int max)
      Reads an integer from the user within a specified range, with a prompt message. Continues to prompt until a valid integer within the range is entered.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The prompt message to display to the user.
      min - The minimum allowed value (inclusive).
      max - The maximum allowed value (inclusive).
      Returns:
      The integer entered by the user within the specified range.

    • readDouble

      public static double readDouble()
      Reads a double from the user with a default prompt message. Continues to prompt until a valid double is entered.
      Returns:
      The double entered by the user.

    • readString

      public static String readString(String prompt)
      Reads a string input from the user with a given prompt.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The prompt message to display to the user.
      Returns:
      The string entered by the user.

    • readString

      public static String readString()
      Reads a string input from the user without a prompt.
      Returns:
      The string entered by the user.

    • readEmail

      public static String readEmail(String prompt)
      Reads a valid email address from the user with a prompt. Continues to prompt until a valid email format is entered.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The prompt message to display to the user.
      Returns:
      A valid email address entered by the user.

    • readGender

      public static String readGender(String prompt)
      Reads and validates a gender input from the user with a prompt. Continues to prompt until a valid gender ("M" or "F") is entered.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The prompt message to display to the user.
      Returns:
      The valid gender entered by the user.

    • promptConfirmation

      public static boolean promptConfirmation(String message)
      Prompts the user for a confirmation with a yes/no question.
      Parameters:
      message - The confirmation message to display.
      Returns:
      true if the user confirms with "yes"; false otherwise.

    • generateUniqueId

      public static <K, V> int generateUniqueId(HashMap<K,V> database)
      Generates a unique ID for a new entry in a HashMap.
      Type Parameters:
      K - The type of the HashMap's keys.
      V - The type of the HashMap's values.
      Parameters:
      database - The HashMap to generate a unique ID for.
      Returns:
      A unique ID based on the current size of the database.

    • getCurrentDateTime

      public static String getCurrentDateTime()
      Returns the current date and time in "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm" format.
      Returns:
      The current date and time as a formatted string.

    • isWeekend

      public static boolean isWeekend(String date)
      Checks if the specified date is on a weekend (Saturday or Sunday).
      Parameters:
      date - The date string in "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm" format.
      Returns:
      true if the date is on a weekend; false otherwise.

    • readDate

      public static LocalDateTime readDate(String prompt)
      Reads a date input from the user in the specified format and returns a LocalDateTime object. Continues to prompt until a valid date is entered.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The prompt message to display to the user.
      Returns:
      LocalDateTime object representing the entered date and time.

    • getFieldOrNull

      public static String getFieldOrNull(String[] fields, int index)
      Retrieves a field from an array by index, returning null if the index is out of bounds or empty.
      Parameters:
      fields - The array of fields.
      index - The index to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The field at the specified index, or null if out of bounds or empty.

    • parseDateTimeOrNull

      public static LocalDateTime parseDateTimeOrNull(String[] fields, int index)
      Parses a LocalDateTime from an array by index, returning null if parsing fails or the field is empty.
      Parameters:
      fields - The array of fields.
      index - The index to parse.
      Returns:
      The LocalDateTime object or null if parsing fails or field is empty.

    • parseDoubleOrNull

      public static Double parseDoubleOrNull(String[] fields, int index)
      Parses a Double from an array by index. Returns null if parsing fails or the field is empty.
      Parameters:
      fields - The array of fields.
      index - The index to parse.
      Returns:
      The Double value or null if parsing fails or the field is empty.

    • isValidEmail

      public static boolean isValidEmail(String email)
      Checks if the provided email matches a valid email format.
      Parameters:
      email - The email address to validate.
      Returns:
      True if the email is valid, false otherwise.

    • isValidGender

      public static boolean isValidGender(String gender)
      Checks if the provided gender input is valid (either "M" or "F").
      Parameters:
      gender - The gender input to validate.
      Returns:
      True if the gender is "M" or "F", false otherwise.
